I felt like I was drowning in responsibilities, and I didn't know how to keep my head above water. I'd look at other moms and think, 'How do they do it? How do they seem so put together?' But the truth is, they're probably just as lost as I am, they're just better at hiding it. I felt like I was failing, like I was failing my kids, my partner, myself. I didn't know how to be a good mom, and I didn't know how to be a good partner, and I didn't know how to be a good person. I felt like I was just going through the motions, trying to survive each day, but not really living. And then one day, something inside of me snapped, and I realized that I couldn't keep going on like this. I needed to make a change, I needed to find a way to take care of myself, to prioritize my own needs, to be the best version of myself, not just for my kids, but for everyone around me.

But for now, I'm just trying to focus on being the best parent I can be, and if that means being a little unconventional, then so be it. I'd rather be a trailblazer than a follower, and if that means my kid grows up to be a little more independent and self-assured because of it, then I'll consider it a success.
